info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 9 at 9:54PM AKDT until July 10 at 9:30PM AKDT by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst is expected.
* WHERE...The Salmon River near areas around mile marker 9 of the Salmon River highway.
* WHEN...Until 930 PM AKDT Thursday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 931 PM AKDT, a trained weather spotter reported that the river water is murky/muddy, flowing quickly, is about 4 ft above its normal level & has risen rather quickly, the river flow is getting rough, making surf/waves in its flow, & trees on the edge of the riverbank are starting to erode into the river, indicating that a glacier-dammed lake outburst in areas around mile marker 9 of the Salmon River highway is occurring. Water is not crossing over the road at this time. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Salmon River. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hyder.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
The cold water temperatures can increase the threat of hypothermia and lower the time required to cause hypothermia.
Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM AKDT THURSDAY
